title: Amazon Bullish about Its Online Apparel Retail Business - Yahoo Finance
text:
Must-Know Factors Driving Amazon's Stock 
( Continued from Prior Part )
Apparel retail business another growth driver for Amazon’s EGM business In the previous part of the series, we discussed the drivers behind Amazon’s (AMZN) Electronics and Other General Merchandise (or EGM) business growth.
During the 2Q15 earnings call, Amazon’s management also mentioned that the company’s online apparel retail business is doing well and is another driver behind its EGM business growth. The management mentioned that it is becoming a big business for the company not only in North America but also internationally.
According to a report from Bloomberg citing Cowen, Amazon could become the number-one apparel retailer in the United States by 2017, surpassing Macy’s (M). The report also mentions that Amazon’s US apparel retail market share will increase from 5% in 2015 to 14% in 2020.

Amazon is a big threat to Walmart and Target Cowen’s lead analyst John Blackledge and his team conducted a survey in which they found that the year-over-year (or YoY) growth of Amazon apparel purchasers was around 29% over the last six quarters. In contrast, YoY growth was around -3% and -2%, respectively, for Walmart (WMT) and Target (TGT). As shown in the chart above, Amazon poses a large threat to brick-and-mortar players.
For diversified exposure to Target, you could invest in the Market Vectors Retail ETF (RTH), which invests about 4.4% of its holdings in Target.
